Description: Type of survey observation
Values:
0 / IP Address: A normal response
1 / Survey Preview: A preview response
2 / Survey Test: A test response
4 / Imported: An imported response
8 / Spam: A possible spam response
9  / Preview Spam: A possible spam response submitted through the preview link
12 / Imported Spam: A possible spam response that was imported
16 / Offline: A Qualtrics Offline App response
17 / Offline Preview: Previews submitted through the Qualtrics Offline App. This feature is deprecated in latest versions of the app

Description: Control Condition: "For the next few minutes, think back over the past day (past 24 hours) and write down five events that somehow affected you."
Control Condition: "For the next few minutes, think back over the past day (past 24 hours) and write down five interesting events that somehow affected you."
Gratitude Intervention: "For the next few minutes, think back over the past week and write down five things in your life that you are grateful or thankful for."

Gratitude Intervention: "Today, we want you to write a letter of gratitude (yped communication that is normally sent in an envelope by mail or messenger) towards someone who who has done something for which you are extremely grateful."

Gratitude Intervention: "deeply. Today, we want you to use your cellphone to text (a short electronic message sent from one cell phone to another using a cellular network) someone who has done something for which you are extremely grateful, and thank them for their kind act(s)."
Gratitude Intervention: "Please reflect on each of the three good moments by asking yourself three questions. What did I receive? What did I give? What more could I do?"
Gratitude Intervention: "Next, please choose one of the five things you have written and describe how your life would be like if that particular moment or person was not present in your life."

Gratitude Intervention: ". Think about how God, a higher power, or some type of spiritual being has benefited you. List how you refer to this entity here and indicate how you would best describe them. Please write a letter to this entity, thanking them for all the ways they have benefited you."

Children should be taught to place duty before pleasure.

You’re working in a company for two years, and one day you meet a co-worker from a different department that you’ve never met before. You are sitting outside a meeting room waiting for the meeting to start, and the two of you start talking. The co-worker starts asking you if you’re married, if you have children, what your hobbies are. Then you remember what a friend of yours told you: “Be careful not to share your personal secrets with people you don’t know because they could use those secrets to hurt you.” Do you agree with this statement?
Children should feel honored if their parents receive a distinguished award.
We should keep our aging parents with us at home.

You are working in a company for two years, and one day you meet a co-worker from a different department that you’ve never met before. You’ve been working on a sales account that could be a big accomplishment. The co-worker asks about the account. You would feel comfortable telling this co-worker about the account. (reverse coded)
They (the people around you) have many chances to get to know other people.
It is common for these people to have a conversation with someone they have never met before.
They are able to choose, according to their own preferences, the people whom they interact with in their daily life.
If they did not like their current groups, they could leave for better ones.
They are able to choose the groups and organizations they belong to.
It is easy for them to meet new people.
It is uncommon for these people to have a conversation with people they have never met before. (reverse coded)
It is often the case that they cannot freely choose who they associate with. (reverse coded)
Even if these people were not completely satisfied with the group they belonged to, they would usually stay with it anyway. (reverse coded)
There are few opportunities for these people to form new friendships. (reverse coded)
Even if these people were not satisfied with their current relationships, they would often have no choice but to stay with them. (reverse coded)
Even though they might rather leave, these people often have no choice but to stay in groups they don’t like. (reverse coded)
I like to make people feel bad when something good has happened to them.
I wouldn’t want to trade places with anyone.  (reverse coded)
I feel angry when others succeed.
It brings me happiness to see my friends succeed. (reverse coded)
I’m content with what I’ve got.  (reverse coded)
I am happy when others succeed even when I don’t.  (reverse coded)
It pains me to think of the success of my friends.
I would rather see someone I don’t know win a lottery than to see an acquaintance win.
